meanings.definition: A description or portrayal of someone or something in a way that is not accurate or true.
meanings.sent1: The mischaracterization of the situation led to confusion.
meanings.sent2: The mischaracterization of the character in the book made the story hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: It was a mischaracterization of the cat to call it a dog.
meanings.sent4: Her mischaracterization of the painting turned it into a completely different piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The mischaracterization of the monster made it seem scarier than it actually was.

meanings.definition: The act of misrepresenting or distorting the true nature of something.
meanings.sent1: His mischaracterization of the facts caused a lot of problems.
meanings.sent2: The mischaracterization of the evidence led to an incorrect conclusion.
meanings.sent3: The mischaracterization of the weather as sunny resulted in a surprise rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: The mischaracterization of the mountain as small was quickly corrected when they reached its base.
meanings.sent5: The mischaracterization of the plant as harmless proved to be a dangerous mistake.
